snippet: Ten gunmen infiltrated Karachi international airport, engaging in an extended firefight against security forces, killing 13 people before security forces killed the militants and regained control of the airport.
abstract: Ten Islamic militants infiltrate Pakistan's largest international airport in Karachi, engaging in explosive, all-night firefight with security forces; battle claims 23 lives, including those of the militants; attack shakes country's already fragile sense of security, and casts suspicion on Pakistani Taliban and related groups that have gained strength over past two years in Karachi.

byline.original: By ZIA ur-REHMAN and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Zia ur-Rehman reported from Karachi, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Declan Walsh contributed from London.

lead_paragraph: Ten gunmen infiltrated Karachi international airport, engaging in an extended firefight against security forces, killing 13 people before security forces killed the militants and regained control of the airport.

headline.main: Terrorists Attack Airport in Pakistan, Killing 13
headline.print_headline: Militants Storm Pakistan Airport in Fierce Attack
